snippet: The F.C.C. has tried to loosen the ownership rule at least three times in the last decade, an effort that has been strongly supported by large media companies.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission chairman Tom Wheeler withdraws his predecessor's proposal to relax longstanding ban on ownership of both newspaper and a broadcaster in same large metropolitan market; FCC has tried to loosen the ownership rule at least three times in the last decade, effort that has been strongly supported by large media companies.
lead_paragraph: The F.C.C. has tried to loosen the ownership rule at least three times in the last decade, an effort that has been strongly supported by large media companies.

headline.main: F.C.C. Withdraws Plan to Relax Ownership Rule
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Withdraws Plan to Relax Ownership Rule
